title: How to Rotate Google Photos on Android

steps.title: Open Google Photos.
steps.content: Open Google Photos . It's the multicolored pinwheel icon labeled “Photos.” You'll usually find it in the app drawer or on the home screen.

steps.title: Tap the image you want to rotate.
steps.content: Tap the image you want to rotate. This opens a larger version of the image with 4 icons at its bottom edge.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . It's the second icon from the left.

steps.title: Tap the crop/rotate icon.
steps.content: Tap the crop/rotate icon. It's the third icon at the bottom of the screen. It looks like a square made of two arrows, surrounded by two more curved arrows.

steps.title: Tap the rotate icon.
steps.content: Tap the rotate icon. It's the diamond with a curved arrow at the bottom-right corner of the screen. This rotates the image 90 degrees counter-clockwise. To rotate another 90 degrees counter-clockwise, tap the rotate icon again. Continue tapping the icon until the image is rotated to your liking.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . The rotated image is now saved.
